page.title: 16LOCAL DIALECT, DUNDEE
page.content: Dundee has many dialect words unique to the area; many of them derive from the Jute Industry: { Bummer:}siren to let local people working in the mills know it was time for work. { Buster:}chips and peas-a Dundee delicacy.Dundee also has a claim to have invented fish and chips. { Cribby:}a kerb. { Fleg:}a fright. { Maik:}an old halfpenny. { Pendie:}passage through a tenement to allow access for horse and cart. { Plettie:}a landing in front of your tenement flat. { Plenny:}a pavement. { Rovies:}shoes made of jute worn by women who worked in jute mills. { Shorers:}swimming baths. { Scrammy:}money the bride and groom throw after their wedding.
